snippet: The New York Police Department can claim many victories, but it is consumed by a single imperative: crime and homicide rates must keep falling.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column asserts the New York City Police Department is consumed by drive to push down crime and homicide rates and that manipulation of crime statistics may be widespread; describes several incidents in which officers have come forward with evidence of questionable practices, only to be reprimanded by the department. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly is the cop from central casting, possessed of a square jaw, swagger and charm, and a flinty willingness to challenge any critic. Of late, party and business leaders have tried to lure him into carrying the Republican banner in the 2013 mayoral derby. Mr. Kelly has so far demurred. He acknowledges that the attention and favorable poll numbers are flattering. But he says he loves running the biggest municipal police force in the country.

headline.main: No Room for Dissent in a Police Department Consumed by the Numbers
